seriesJson.title: About science
seriesJson.description: Interview series on variety of science-related subjects, produced by the California Institute of Technology. Features three Cal Tech faculty members: Dr. Peter Lissaman, Dr. Albert R. Hibbs, and Dr. Robert Meghreblian.

node.title: About astroelectronics
node.description: This program focuses on space telescopes. The guest for this program is Dr. Edwin Dennison.

node.title: About high speed ground transportation
node.description: This program focuses on the science behind high speed ground transportation. Speakers in this program are Dr. Peter Lissaman and Dr. Albert Hibbs, both of the California Institute of Technology.

node.title: About the Moon
node.description: This program focuses on scientific study of the Moon. The guest for this program is Dr. Albert Hibbs, California Institute of Technology.

node.title: About vision
node.description: This program focuses on the study of vision. The guest for this program is Dr. Derek Fender, California Institute of Technology.

node.title: About the mountains of Venus
node.description: This program focuses on the use of radio to explore the terrain of Venus. The guest for this program is Dr. Richard Goldstein.

node.title: About the new chemistry
node.description: This program focuses on the state of chemistry. The guest for the program is Dr. George Hammond.

node.title: About fungi
node.description: This program focuses on the field of mycology.

node.title: About science in Japan
node.description: This program focuses on the state of science in Japan.

node.title: About superhot atmospheres
node.description: This program focuses on the scientific study of superhot atmospheres. The guest for this program is Dr. Arthur Vaughan, Jr.

node.title: About dissecting a star
node.description: This program focuses on the science of stars. The guest for this program is Dr. Robert Christy.

node.title: About the nature of life
node.description: This program focuses on a scientific view of the nature of life. The guest for this program is Dr. Robert Sinsheimer.

node.title: About development in animals
node.description: This program focuses on zoology. The guest for this program is Dr. Albert Tyler.

node.title: About Caltech's patents
node.description: This program focuses on the patent system and the patents owned by the California Institute of Technology.

node.title: About metals
node.description: This program focuses on the science behind metals.

node.title: About bioengineering vital organs
node.description: This program focuses on the science of artificial organs. The guest for this program is Dr. Sheldon Friedlander.

node.title: About building a virus
node.description: This program focuses on the construction of a virus. The guest is Dr. Robert Edgar.

node.title: About arms control
node.description: This program focuses on the issue of arms control.

node.title: About continental drift
node.description: This program focuses on the scientific study of continental drift. The guest for this program is Dr. Arthur Boucot.

node.title: About space exploration
node.description: This program focuses on space exploration.

node.title: About quasi stellar objects
node.description: This program focuses on the study of starlight. The guest for this program is Dr. J. Beverley Oke.

node.title: About weather modification
node.description: This program focuses on the science behind weather modification. The guest for this program is Dr. Paul B. MacCready.

node.title: About computer languages
node.description: This program focuses on the development of computer languages.

node.title: About science and government
node.description: This program focuses on the support that governments give to scientific research. The guest for this program is David Elliott.

node.title: About communication between scientists and laymen
node.description: This program focuses on the gap of understanding between scientists and non-scientists. The guest for this program is science writer Irving Bengelsdorf.

node.title: About radio telescopes
node.description: This program focuses on the use of radio telescopes for space research. The guest for this program is Alan Moffet.

node.title: About the oldest mountain range
node.description: This program focuses on scientific study of the oldest mountain range. The guest for this program is Dr. Leon Silver.

node.title: About the early universe
node.description: This program focuses on scientific study of the early universe. The guest for this program is Robert Wagoner.

node.title: About the Earth's mantle
node.description: This program focuses on the scientific study of the Earth's mantle. The guest for this program is Dr. Don Anderson.

node.title: About current developments in family planning
node.description: This program focuses on family planning. The guest for this program is Dr. Robert W. Gillespie.

node.title: About geologic history in the making
node.description: This program focuses on studying changes in the shape of the surface of the Earth. The guest for this program is Dr. Stewart Smith.

node.title: About thin shells
node.description: This program focuses on thin shells, structures that are very thin in one direction, as compared to another direction.

node.title: About fallout
node.description: This program focuses on the definition of fallout. The guest for this program is Milton Plesset.

node.title: About technology in India
node.description: This program focuses on the growth of technology in India. The guest for this program is Dr. Peter Fay.

node.title: About elastic water
node.description: This program discusses the accidental discovery of "elastic water," a mixture of plastic and water. The guest for this program is the man who made the discovery, David James.

node.title: About Africa
node.description: This program focuses on the social science field of political geography and the study of Africa. The guest for this program is Dr. Edwin Munger.

node.title: About engineering aspects of the cardiovascular system
node.description: This program focuses on the study of the engineering aspects of the cardiovascular system. The guest for this program is Dr. Michael G. Taylor.

node.title: About hydromagnetics
node.description: This program focuses on hydromagnetics, the study of the magnetic properties of electrically conducting fluids.

node.title: About the mechanics of chemical reactions
node.description: This program focuses on the study of chemical reactions. The guest for this program is Dr. Aron Kuppermann.

node.title: About planetary atmospheres
node.description: This program focuses on the study of planetary atmospheres. The guest is Dr. Lewis Kaplan.

node.title: About exobiology
node.description: This program discusses exobiology, the search for life beyond Earth, and the effects of extraterrestrial environments on living things. The guest for this program is Jerry Soffen.

node.title: About soil engineering
node.description: This program discusses the science of soil engineering. The guest for this program is soil engineer Ronald Scott.

node.title: About soil engineering
node.description: This program discusses the science of soil engineering. The guest for this program is soil engineer Ronald Scott.

node.title: About international cooperation in space
node.description: This program focuses on international cooperation in space exploration.

node.description: This program focuses on the science of man-made islands. The guest for this program is Fredric Raichlen.

node.description: This program focuses on the science of man-made islands. The guest for this program is Fredric Raichlen.

node.description: This program focuses on the science of earthquake engineering. The guest for this program is Paul Jennings.

node.description: This program focuses on the science of earthquake engineering. The guest for this program is Paul Jennings.

node.title: About lead in the atmosphere
node.description: This program focuses on the study of lead in the atmosphere. The guest for this program is geochemist Clair Patterson.

node.title: About solar winds
node.description: This program focuses on the scientific study of solar winds. The guest for this program is American geophysicist Marcia Neugebauer.

node.description: This program focuses on the scientific study of solar winds. The guest for this program is American geophysicist Marcia Neugebauer.

node.title: About artificial intelligence
node.description: This program focuses on the science behind artificial intelligence. The guest for this program is Dr. Gilbert D. McCann, California Institute of Technology.

node.description: This program focuses on the science behind artificial intelligence. The guest for this program is Dr. Gilbert D. McCann, California Institute of Technology.

node.title: About Surveyor
node.description: This program focuses on the science behind the  Surveyor program that sent spacecraft to the Moon. The guest for this program is Dr. Leonard Jaffe, Surveyor Project Scientist, Jet Propulsion Laboratory.

node.title: About man-made African lakes
node.description: This program focuses on the science behind man-made African lakes. The guest for this program is Dr. Thayer Scudder, anthropology professor and consultant to International Bank for Reconstruction and Development.

node.title: About color vision
node.description: This program focuses on vision and the color spectrum. The guest for this program is Dr. Richard P. Feynman, 1965 Nobel Laureate, winner of the Albert Einstein Award, professor of theoretical physics at California Institute of Technology.

node.description: This program focuses on the science of sand dunes. The guest for this program is Dr. Robert P. Sharp, California Institute of Technology.

node.description: This program focuses on the science of sand dunes. The guest for this program is Dr. Robert P. Sharp, California Institute of Technology.

node.title: About earthquakes and faults
node.description: This program focuses on the science of earthquakes and faults. The guest with the program is Dr. Clarence Allen, director, Seismological Laboratory.

node.title: About seaweed
node.description: This program connections between seaweed and science. The guest for this program is Dr. Wheeler North, California Institute of Technology.

node.title: About ocean pollution
node.description: This program focuses on how science can help with ocean pollution. The guest for this program is Dr. Norman Brooks, California Institute of Technology.

node.description: This program explores the quest to find life on Mars. The guest for this program is Dr. Norman Horowitz, California Institute of Technology.

node.title: About a gilded age?
node.description: This program focuses on humanity in an age of science. The guest for this program is Dr. Dan Kevles, California Institute of Technology.

node.title: About the space program
node.description: This program focuses on the science behind the United States space program. The guest for this program is Dr. Bruce Murray, consultant to National Aeronautics and Space Administration, member of National Academy of Sciences' Space Science Board.
